fields.content:
The Santa Clara Convention Center is located at 5001 Great America Pkwy, Santa Clara, Ca. We are less than 5 miles from the San Jose International Airport (SJC). Suggested methods of transportation to/from this airport would be by car, shuttle, limo/sedan, taxi, or light rail.

[Rental Car Information](http://www.sjc.org/travelers.php?page=ground_trans/rental&subtitle=Ground+Transportation+|+Rental+Cars "Rental car information") from SJC.

[Directions](http://maps.google.com/maps?saddr=San+Jose+International+Airport,+San+Jose,+CA&daddr=Santa+Clara,+CA+95054+(Santa+Clara+Convention+Center)&hl=en&ll=37.390482,-121.942406&spn=0.073104,0.158787&sll=37.386526,-121.960773&sspn=0.073108,0.158787&geocode=FUIoOgIdlpq7-CE-fvZtP0T6vA%3BFdu8OgIdk826-CHk0nAH5vfrwQ&mra=pd&t=h&z=13 "Directions by car from SJC") by car from SJC.

Taxi Information can be found [here](http://www.sjc.org/travelers.php?page=ground_trans/taxi&subtitle=Ground+Transportation+|+Taxis "Taxi Information").
A taxi ride from SJC to the Santa Clara Convention Center is estimated to cost between $17 and $27 one way. 

Shuttle Information - The Hyatt Regency Santa Clara does not have a shuttle service from the SJC airport, however, there are [independent shuttle companies](http://www.sjc.org/travelers.php?page=ground_trans/d2d&subtitle=Ground+Transportation+|+Door-to-Door+Shuttles "Independent shuttle companies") available. 
The average cost for a shuttle drop off from the SJC airport to the is $21 per person.
 
The Santa Clara Convention Center is located approximately 45 miles from San Francisco Airport (SFO). Best methods of transportation from this airport would be by car, shuttle, or limo/sedan.

The Santa Clara Convention Center is located at 5001 Great America Pkwy, Santa Clara, Ca. We are less than 5 miles from the San Jose International Airport (SJC). Suggested methods of transportation to/from this airport would be by car, shuttle, limo/sedan, taxi, or light rail.

Rental Car Information from SJC.

Directions by car from SJC.

Taxi Information can be found here. A taxi ride from SJC to the Santa Clara Convention Center is estimated to cost between $17 and $27 one way.

Shuttle Information - The Hyatt Regency Santa Clara does not have a shuttle service from the SJC airport, however, there are independent shuttle companies available. The average cost for a shuttle drop off from the SJC airport to the is $21 per person.

The Santa Clara Convention Center is located approximately 45 miles from San Francisco Airport (SFO). Best methods of transportation from this airport would be by car, shuttle, or limo/sedan.
fields.label: directions

fields.content:
For those driving, the Santa Clara Convention Center (and the Hyatt Regency Santa Clara) is conveniently located between two freeways (highway 101 and 237) with easy access. Whether you choose to go to San Francisco for a day or explore other things to do in the area, highway 101 can get you there directly or to another freeway that can.
 
The VTA Light Rail station is located immediately across the street from the Santa Clara Convention Center. This mode of transportation will take you to several eateries and other attraction at neighboring cities including downtown San Jose, Milpitas, Campbell, and Mountain View.  The current fare for an 8-hour Light Rail pass is $4 and a single ride is $2. However, a single ride light rail ticket is valid for up to 2 hours in any direction only on Light Rail and Historic Trolley service. It is not acceptable toward the fare on bus service.
More information can be found at: [www.vta.org](http://www.vta.org "VTA").
 
For those preferring Taxi cabs, cabs are usually stationed outside many of the hotel properties. Ask hotel concierge/front desk if cab is not present or if prefer limo/sedan transportation.

The current fare for an 8-hour Light Rail pass is $4 and a single ride is $2. However, a single ride light rail ticket is valid for up to 2 hours in any direction only on Light Rail and Historic Trolley service. It is not acceptable toward the fare on bus service. More information can be found at: www.vta.org.

For those preferring Taxi cabs, cabs are usually stationed outside many of the hotel properties. Ask hotel concierge/front desk if cab is not present or if prefer limo/sedan transportation.

fields.label: bars

fields.content:
#### Franklin Square
Franklin Square is home to a weekly Farmer's Market on Saturdays from 9:00 a.m. - 1:00 p.m. It also has several shops, services, and restaurants including the popular Mio Vicino. Located at Homestead Road and Monroe, Santa Clara, CA.

#### [Gilroy Premium Outlets](http://www.premiumoutlets.com/gilroy/ "Gilroy Premium Outlets")
Located south of San Jose, Gilroy Premium Outlets features an unparalleled collection of designer and name brand outlet stores. With 145 outlet stores, shoppers will find impressive savings at Ann Taylor, Brooks Brothers Factory Store, Coach, Polo Ralph Lauren, Sony and More. The Outlets bring together the finest brands, unique outdoor settings and savings of 25 to 65 percent every day.

#### [Great Mall Of The Bay Area](http://www.simon.com/mall/default.aspx?ID=1250 "Great Mall of the Bay Area")
Northern California's largest outlet mall. Great Mall has over 185 outlet, off-price and specialty stores all under one roof. Plus numerous restaurants, and two entertainment centers. Located off I-880 in Milpitas at Great Mall Parkway and Montague Expressway. (408) 956-2033

#### Mercado Santa Clara 
This entertainment complex includes a 20-screen AMC Theatre, Micro Center Computer Store, and popular food establishments: Tomatina's, Starbucks, Jamba Juice, Mexicali Grill, and Yo Yo Sushi. Mercado is located between Hwy. 101 and Great America Parkway on Mission College Boulevard, Santa Clara, CA 95054. AMC Mercado 20 Theatre: (408) 919-0282

#### Moonlite Shopping Center
Featured business is the Moonlite Lanes bowling alley. Also, home to SaveMart, Office Depot, and other businesses. Located at El Camino Real and Kiely Boulevard, Santa Clara, CA.

#### Rivermark Plaza 
Rivermark features many shops and restaurants, including Piatti Restaurant and Red Robin. Also on-site is the Hotel Sierra. Located at 3900 Rivermark Plaza, Santa Clara, CA.

#### [Santana Row](http://www.santanarow.com/ "Santana Row")
Upscale shopping, spas, many restaurants, CineArts movie theatre, special events, and much more. Located at Stevens Creek Boulevard, at Winchester Boulevard, in San Jose, CA.

#### [Westfield Valley Fair](http://www.westfield.com/valleyfair "Westfield Valley Fair")
One of Northern California's largest enclosed shopping malls with specialty shops, elegant boutiques, major department stores, and a 450-seat food pavilion. Located at I-880 and Stevens Creek Boulevard, Santa Clara, CA. (408) 248-4451

fields.label: shopping

fields.content:
Attractions in Santa Clara

###### [Agnews Historic Cemetery and Museum](http://santaclaraca.gov/index.aspx?page=1411 "") Museum housing artifacts from the Agnews Developmental Center which for 120 years housed people with mental and physical disabilities. Tours are free, but by appointment only.
1250 Hope Drive
Santa Clara, CA 95054
(408) 615-3790
###### [Artsopolis](http://www.artsopolis.com/ "") Silicon Valley's ultimate online guide to Arts and Culture providing a comprehensive calendar of Arts and Cultural events.
4 North Second Street
Suite 275
San Jose, CA 95113
###### [Blue & Gold Fleet](http://www.blueandgoldfleet.com/ "") Experience the beauty of San Francisco Bay & Beyond - the best cruise values and land tours begin from Pier 41/PIER 39.
Pier 41, Fisherman's Wharf
San Francisco, CA 94133
Tel: (415) 773-1188
Fax: (415) 705-5429
###### [de Saisset Museum](http://www.scu.edu/deSaisset/ "") The museum's permanent collection includes American, European, African, and Oriental art. The California History Collection displays artifacts of the pre-mission California Indians and relics from the original Mission Santa Clara. Located at
Santa Clara University
Santa Clara, CA 95053
(408) 554-4528
###### [California's Great America](http://www.cagreatamerica.com/ "") The only theme park in California to offer a complete water park inside - free with admission. The Snoopy, including a chance to visit with Snoopy, Charlie Brown, and other Peanuts characters. The park is located at Great America Parkway between I-101 and Highway 237 in Santa Clara. Open April through October.
4701 Great America Parkway
Santa Clara, CA 95054
(408) 988-1776
###### [Harris-Lass House Museum](http://www.harrislass.org/ "") Santa Clara's last farmstead includes a restored house, barn, summer kitchen, and tankhouse. Operated by the Historic Preservation Society.
1889 Market Street
Santa Clara, CA 95050
(408) 249-7905
###### [Intel Museum](http://www.intel.com/about/companyinfo/museum/index.htm "") An interactive museum which introduces visitors to the micro-miniature world of computer chips. Open Monday through Saturday.
Intel Corporation, Robert Noyce Building
2200 Mission College Boulevard
Santa Clara, CA 95052
(408) 765-0503
###### [Mission Santa Clara de Asis](http://www.scu.edu/visitors/mission/ "") The eighth of 21 missions built in California, founded in 1777 by the Spanish Franciscans. (California Historical Landmark No. 338) Located on the grounds of picturesque Santa Clara University, Santa Clara, CA 95053. (408) 554-4023 Santa Clara Historic Museum Housed in the Headen-Inman house, the museum features historic artifacts and photos related to the history of Santa Clara.
1509 Warburton Avenue
Santa Clara, CA 95050
(408) 248-2789
###### [Santa Clara Woman's Club Adobe](http://www.santaclarawomansclub.org/ "") One of the oldest adobes in California. Built about 1790, this structure was originally part of a row of houses for married Indian couples.
California Historical Landmark No. 249
3260 The Alameda
Santa Clara, CA 95050
(408) 246-8000
###### [Shrine of Our Lady of Peace](http://www.rc.net/sanjose/shrnolp/shrnolp.htm "") Dedicated to the Immaculate Heart of Mary, this 32- foot stainless steel sculpture is a reminder to visitors to work and pray daily for peace. Located at
Our Lady of Peace Church
2800 Mission College Boulevard
Santa Clara, CA 95054
(408) 988-4585
###### [South Bay Historical Railroad Society](http://www.sbhrs.org/ "") Founded in 1985 to preserve the heritage of American railroading, the Historical Railroad Society is located in the historic Santa Clara Depot.
1005 Railroad Avenue
Santa Clara, CA 95050
(408) 243-3969
###### [The Tech Museum](http://www.thetech.org/ "") Hands-on, imaginative, high-tech exhibits showcase the past, present, and future of Silicon Valley. The museum is also home to a state-of-the-art IMAX Dome Theater.
201 South Market Street
San Jose, CA 95113
(408) 294-TECH
###### [Triton Museum of Art](http://www.tritonmuseum.org/ "") Rotating exhibits highlight the museum's permanent collection of 19th and 20th century American art. Also permanent is Triton's sculpture garden located on the seven-acre grounds.
1505 Warburton Avenue (across from city hall)
Santa Clara, CA 95050
(408) 247-3754
###### [Winchester Mystery House](http://www.winchestermysteryhouse.com/ "") A beautiful, but bizarre 160-room Victorian mansion built by the Winchester heiress.
California Historical Landmark No. 868
525 South Winchester Boulevard
San Jose 95128
(408) 247-2000

Nearby Attractions

###### [Airship Ventures](http://www.airshipventures.com/ "") Airship Ventures flies Eureka, a Zeppelin NT airship, around the SF Bay Area for daily sightseeing flights, advertising operations, corporate and event occasions and scientific missions. Based out of Moffett Field, the airship also flies out of North Oakland and Monterey! ###### [Children's Discovery Museum](http://www.cdm.org/index.asp?f=1 "") One of the largest museum's of it's kind in the nation, over 150 interactive exhibits lead visitors to explore, understand and enjoy the world in which they live.
180 Woz Way
San Jose, CA 95110
(408) 298-5437
###### [Coyote Ranch](http://www.coyoteranch.com/Coyote_Ranch/Home.html "") Beautiful western setting for group parties or conventions. Barbecue, dancing, and moonlit hay rides.
South on Highway 101 on Metcalf Road
P.O. Box 13036, Coyote, 95013
(408) 463-0661
###### [Lick Observatory](http://www.ucolick.org/ "") Located atop 4,209 foot Mount Hamilton, the observatory is 30 miles southeast of Santa Clara up winding Highway 130. Public programs are available by calling (408) 274-5061. ###### [NASA Ames Exploration Center](http://www.nasa.gov/centers/ames/home/index.html "") Features rotating exhibits of artifacts from space missions and demonstrations of research equipment, such as the human centrifuge and flight simulator. Open Monday-Friday.
Moffett Field
Mountain View, CA 94035
(650) 604-6497
###### [Pier 39](http://www.pier39.com/index.cfm "") San Francisco's Premier Bay Area Attraction with more than 100 unique shops and 13 full-service Bay view restaurants and numerous attractions including the Blue & Gold Fleet and Aquarium of the Bay. For more information, call (415) 705-5500. ###### [Raging Waters San Jose](http://www.rwsplash.com/ "") Water park with water slides, family play areas and a 350,000 gallon wave pool. Open May through September.
Tully Road, Lake Cunningham Park
San Jose, CA 95148
(408) 238-9900
###### [Red & White Fleet](http://www.redandwhite.com/ "") Sail along San Francisco's waterfront, under the Golden Gate Bridge, past Angel Island and around Alcatraz on Red and White Fleet's 1-hour Golden Gate Bay Cruise with frequent daily departures from Pier 43 1/2. Audio narration in 8 languages. For more information, call (415) 673-2900. ###### [Roaring Camp Railroads](http://www.roaringcamp.com/ "") Forty minutes west of Santa Clara, groups can take an 1880's steam train ride to the top of Bear Mountain or to the ocean at the Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk.
Located off Highway 17 at Mt.Herman Road
P.O. Box G-1
Felton, CA 95018
(831) 335-4484
###### [Stanford Linear Accelerator Center](http://www.slac.stanford.edu/ "") A 426-acre research laboratory for the U.S. Department of Energy, offering a guided tour, which includes a lecture, Slide presentation and a look at experiments.
2275 Sand Hill Road
Menlo Park, CA 94025
(650) 926-8703

Sports & Recreation

###### [Deep Cliff Golf Course](http://playdeepcliff.com/ "")
10700 Clubhouse Lane
Cupertino, CA 95014
(408) 253-5357
###### [George F. Haines International Swim Center](http://santaclaraca.gov/index.aspx? page=1456 "") The world class facility has been home of many Olympic gold medal winners. The center is the setting for nationally televised sports events, including international swim meets, and synchronized swimming.
2625 Patricia Avenue
Santa Clara, CA 95051
(408) 243-7727
Moonlite Lanes Bowling is fun for everyone in downtown Santa Clara.
2780 El Camino Real
Santa Clara, CA 95051
(408) 296-7200
###### [Pruneridge Golf Club](http://www.pruneridgegolfclub.com/golf/proto/pruneridgegolfclub/ "") Nine hole course.
400 North Saratoga Avenue
Santa Clara, CA 95050
(408) 248-4424
###### [San Jose Earthquakes](http://www.sjearthquakes.com/ "") Men's Bay Area Major League Soccer (MLS) professional team. Games played at
Buck Shaw Stadium at Santa Clara University 500 El Camino Real
Santa Clara, CA
(408) 556-7700
###### [San Jose Sabercats](http://www.thesanjosesabercats.com/ "") Professional Arena Football League (AFL) team plays its 2011 Home Games from March 11 - July 9 at HP Pavilion. Corporate office:
600 East Brokaw Road
San Jose, 95112
###### [San Jose Wolves](http://www.sanjosewolves.com/ "") Hard hitting, bone crunching Arena Football is back. Huge discounts for "Cats" Season Tickets holders. All home games at Cow Palace in South San Francisco. For more information, call (877) 9-WOLVES. ###### [Santa Clara County Bike Trails](http://www.parkhere.org/portal/site/parks/parkschp?path=%2Fv7%2FParks%20and%20Recreation%2C%20Department%20of%20%28DEP %29%2Fmain_menu%2FBike%20Here "") 17 regional parks have dedicated bike-friendly trails. Ten of those parks offer off-road bicycling opportunities from gentle and mild paved trails to hard core, wear-all-your-armor wild mountain bike trails. ###### [Santa Clara Golf & Tennis Club](http://santaclaraca.gov/index.aspx?page=240 "") The golf club features 18 championship holes, seven lighted tennis courts, and a restaurant on site. Tournaments welcome.
5155 Stars & Stripes Drive
Santa Clara, CA 95054
(408) 980-9515
###### [San Francisco 49ers Headquarters & Practice Facility](http://www.49ers.com/ "") Viewing only of the 49er Super Bowl trophies in the lobby of the facility. Practices are not open to the public. No autographs allowed.
4949 Centennial Boulevard
Santa Clara, CA 95054
(408) 562-4949
###### [Sky High Sports](http://www.jumpskyhigh.com/ "")
2880 Mead Avenue
Santa Clara, CA 95051
(408) 492-1139

Wineries

###### [Byington Winery](http://www.byington.com/ "")
21850 Bear Creek Road
Los Gatos, CA 95030
(408) 354-1111
###### [Cinnabar Vineyards](http://www.cinnabar.org/ "")
23000 Congress Springs Road
Saratoga, CA 95070
(408) 741-5858
###### [Cinnabar Winery](http://cinnabarwine.com/ "")
14612 Big Basin Way
Saratoga, CA 95050
(408) 867-1012
###### [J. Lohr Winery](http://www.jlohr.com/ "")
1000 Lenzen Avenue
San Jose, CA 95126
(408) 288-5057
###### [The Mountain Winery](http://www.mountainwinery.com/ "")
14831 Pierce Road
Saratoga, CA 95070
(408) 741-2822
###### [Thomas Fogarty Winery Winery](http://www.fogartywinery.com/ "")
19501 Skyline Boulevard
Woodside, CA 94062
(650) 851-6777
The VTA Light Rail station can take you to many popular destinations in the Santa Clara region. The information is accessible through their [website](http://www.vta.org/schedules/popular_destinations.html ""). It includes destinations, connection information, and Light Rail routes.

Santa Clara County Bike Trails

17 regional parks have dedicated bike-friendly trails. Ten of those parks offer off-road bicycling opportunities from gentle and mild paved trails to hard core, wear-all-your-armor wild mountain bike trails.

The golf club features 18 championship holes, seven lighted tennis courts, and a restaurant on site. Tournaments welcome.

fields.label: explore

fields.content:
In March, the average high temperature in Santa Clara is 65 degrees and low is 45 degrees. Santa Clara typically has quite nice weather year-round. However, please prepare to bring some cooler outfits for the evenings and be prepared for some precipitation. Keep in mind that event room temperatures tend to fluctuate, please wear closes in layers to ensure your comfortability at all times. The below websites provide pre-weekly forecasts:
[www.timeanddate.com](http://www.timeanddate.com "Time and Date")
[www.weather.gov ](http://www.weather.gov "Weather")
[forcast.weather.gov](http://forcast.weather.gov "Forcast Weather") Please search the internet for "15 day weather forecast santa clara" to get more of an idea of trends likely for the time of the conference (e.g. rain, gradually warmer).
fields._content_rendered:
In March, the average high temperature in Santa Clara is 65 degrees and low is 45 degrees. Santa Clara typically has quite nice weather year-round. However, please prepare to bring some cooler outfits for the evenings and be prepared for some precipitation.

Keep in mind that event room temperatures tend to fluctuate, please wear closes in layers to ensure your comfortability at all times.

The below websites provide pre-weekly forecasts:
www.timeanddate.com
www.weather.gov
forcast.weather.gov

Please search the internet for "15 day weather forecast santa clara" to get more of an idea of trends likely for the time of the conference (e.g. rain, gradually warmer).
